messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Sacramento Conference
messages.msgSnippet: ** I m going to be there but I m not a Pam. Can I be in the club? ;~) ** Yes!!!!  We ll even try really hard to remember your real name, Mary, and not call you
messages.messageBody:
**
I'm going to be there but I'm not a Pam. Can I be in the club? ;~)
**

Yes!!!! We'll even try really hard to remember your real name, Mary,
and not call you Pam-just-because-it's-easier-to-remember and a likely
guess in this group. <bweg>

**I'm game if I can stay awake (this is not an insult to you guys- I
just get sleepy)**

I will be yawning a lot, too. It's not meant to be personal.

Betsy

messages.authorName: Gary m and Mary Anne Taylor
messages.subject: Sacramento Conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m going to be there but I m not a Pam. Can I be in the club? ;~) My 14dd (yes, the one with no interests ) is on the Teen Conference Committee, so we
messages.messageBody:
> Anybody going to the HSC Conference in Sacramento this weekend? I know
> Betsy, Pam S. and Pam H. are. With me that's 3 Pams. Anyone else?
> And can we
> have an unschooling get together? Maybe past midnight......

I'm going to be there but I'm not a Pam. Can I be in the club? ;~)
My 14dd (yes, the one with 'no interests') is on the Teen Conference Committee, so we will arrive Thursday afternoon. I'm game if I can stay awake (this is not an insult to you guys- I just get sleepy)
I would Love to meet Pams and Betsy and Joylyn.
Mary T.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Sacramento Conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... we ... It looks like they ve put me at 8:30 on Sunday morning to speak on the Unschooling panel (I ll have to lodge a formal protest  as it s cruel to
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-Discussion] Digest Number 3914
>Date: Wed, Aug 13, 2003, 3:11 AM
>

> Anybody going to the HSC Conference in Sacramento this weekend? I know
> Betsy, Pam S. and Pam H. are. With me that's 3 Pams. Anyone else? And can
we
> have an unschooling get together? Maybe past midnight......
>
> Pam T.


It looks like they've put me at 8:30 on Sunday morning to speak on the
Unschooling panel (I'll have to lodge a formal protest <g> as it's cruel to
make me talk that early.)

I will be breezing into town (okay, at that hour, stumbling) just to talk
and run, but would be happy to chatter and drink coffee with anyone after
the panel ends at 10 a.m.

I *could* also go nap in the car at 10 a.m. and then meet everyone for lunch
(don't think I'm kidding, it's exactly what I did last year, when they put
me on the "Everyone-Here-Is-Unschooling-Of-Course-In-Spite-Of-Any
Curriculum-They-Happen-To-Be-Using-They-Just-Unschool-On-The-Weekends-Except
-For-Math" Panel -- i.e, Methods and Styles). After my violent twitchings
they somehow did NOT select me for it again. What poor unsuspecting
Unschooler sap did they rope in for it this year? I should warn them to
bring a muzzle for themselves. And sedatives.

Pam H.
